Package org.sat4j.pb

Interface IPBSolver

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.sat4j.specs.IProblem, org.sat4j.specs.ISolver, org.sat4j.specs.RandomAccessModel, Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IGroupPBSolver, IIntegerPBSolver, IPBCDCLSolver<D>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLinMultiObjOptimizer, ClausalConstraintsDecorator, ConstraintRelaxingPseudoOptDecorator, GroupPBSelectorSolver, InprocCardConstrLearningSolver, IntegerPBSolverDecorator, LexicoDecoratorPB, LeximinDecorator, LPStringSolver, ManyCoreIntegerPB, ManyCorePB, MinSumOWAOptimizer, ObjectiveReducerPBSolverDecorator, OPBStringSolver, OptimalModelIterator, OptToPBSATAdapter, OrderedObjsOWAOptimizer, PBAdapter, PBSolver, PBSolverCautious, PBSolverClause, PBSolverCP, PBSolverCPCardLearning, PBSolverCPClauseLearning, PBSolverCPLong, PBSolverCPLongDivideBy2, PBSolverCPLongDivideByGCD, PBSolverCPLongReduceToCard, PBSolverCPLongRounding, PBSolverCPReduceByGCD, PBSolverCPReduceByPowersOf2, PBSolverDecorator, PBSolverHandle, PBSolverResCP, PBSolverResolution, PBSolverWithImpliedClause, PreprocCardConstrLearningSolver, PseudoIteratorDecorator, PseudoOptDecorator, SteppedTimeoutLexicoDecoratorPB, SumLeximinDecompositionOWAOptimizer, UserFriendlyPBStringSolver, XplainPB
    public interface IPBSolver
extends org.sat4j.specs.ISolver
    A solver able to deal with pseudo boolean constraints.
    Author:
    daniel

    • Method Detail

      • addPseudoBoolean

        org.sat4j.specs.IConstr addPseudoBoolean​(org.sat4j.specs.IVecInt lits,
                                         org.sat4j.specs.IVec<BigInteger> coeffs,
                                         boolean moreThan,
                                         BigInteger d)
                                  throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
        Create a Pseudo-Boolean constraint of the type "at least n or at most n of those literals must be satisfied"
        Parameters:
        lits - a set of literals. The vector can be reused since the solver is not supposed to keep a reference to that vector.
        coeffs - the coefficients of the literals. The vector can be reused since the solver is not supposed to keep a reference to that vector.
        moreThan - true if it is a constraint >= degree, false if it is a constraint <= degree
        d - the degree of the cardinality constraint
        Returns:
        a reference to the constraint added in the solver, to use in removeConstr().
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - iff the vector of literals is empty or if the constraint is falsified after unit propagation
        See Also:
        ISolver.removeConstr(IConstr)

      • addAtMost

        org.sat4j.specs.IConstr addAtMost​(org.sat4j.specs.IVecInt literals,
                                  org.sat4j.specs.IVecInt coeffs,
                                  int degree)
                           throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
        Create a pseudo boolean constraint of the type "at most".
        Parameters:
        literals - a set of literals The vector can be reused since the solver is not supposed to keep a reference to that vector.
        coeffs - the coefficients of the literals. The vector can be reused since the solver is not supposed to keep a reference to that vector.
        degree - the degree of the pseudo-boolean constraint
        Returns:
        a reference to the constraint added in the solver, to use in removeConstr().
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - iff the constraint is found trivially unsat.
        Since:
        2.3.1
        See Also:
        ISolver.removeConstr(IConstr)

      • addExactly

        org.sat4j.specs.IConstr addExactly​(org.sat4j.specs.IVecInt literals,
                                   org.sat4j.specs.IVecInt coeffs,
                                   int weight)
                            throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
        Create a pseudo-boolean constraint of the type "subset sum".
        Parameters:
        literals - a set of literals. The vector can be reused since the solver is not supposed to keep a reference to that vector.
        coeffs - the coefficients of the literals. The vector can be reused since the solver is not supposed to keep a reference to that vector.
        weight - the number of literals that must be satisfied
        Returns:
        a reference to the constraint added to the solver. It might return an object representing a group of constraints.
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - iff the constraint is trivially unsatisfiable.
        Since:
        2.3.1

      • addExactly

        org.sat4j.specs.IConstr addExactly​(org.sat4j.specs.IVecInt literals,
                                   org.sat4j.specs.IVec<BigInteger> coeffs,
                                   BigInteger weight)
                            throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
        Create a pseudo-boolean constraint of the type "subset sum".
        Parameters:
        literals - a set of literals. The vector can be reused since the solver is not supposed to keep a reference to that vector.
        coeffs - the coefficients of the literals. The vector can be reused since the solver is not supposed to keep a reference to that vector.
        weight - the number of literals that must be satisfied
        Returns:
        a reference to the constraint added to the solver. It might return an object representing a group of constraints.
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - iff the constraint is trivially unsatisfiable.
        Since:
        2.3.1
